subject: Communication
title: Social Proof in Audience Reactions
description: One-minute skill: Social Proof in Audience Reactions.

hook.text: When one person starts clapping, suddenly everyone joins. That's not politeness â€” it's psychology.

buildup.text: Social proof is our tendency to follow what others do, especially when we're uncertain how to react.

discovery.text: TV sitcoms use laugh tracks because hearing laughter makes jokes feel 30% funnier to viewers.

twist.text: In live audiences, a few engaged front-row listeners can shift the energy of an entire room.

climax.text: Smart speakers 'seed' reactions by placing allies in the audience or engaging specific people early.

punchline.text: Audiences don't just hear you. They watch each other.

quiz.question: Why do TV shows use laugh tracks?
options: Social proof makes jokes seem funnier
